**Kimberly Jonathan "Kim" Hyde** was a [fictional
character](/wiki/Character_\(arts\) "Character \(arts\)") from the Australian
soap opera _[Home and Away](/wiki/Home_and_Away "Home and Away")_ , played by
[Chris Hemsworth](/wiki/Chris_Hemsworth "Chris Hemsworth"). He made his first
on screen appearance on 17 February 2004 and departed on 3 July 2007.

## Contents

  * 1 Casting
  * 2 Storylines
  * 3 Reception
  * 4 References
  * 5 External links

## Casting[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Kim_Hyde&action=edit&section=1 "Edit
section: Casting")]

Hemsworth originally auditioned for the role of [Robbie
Hunter](/wiki/Robbie_Hunter_\(Home_and_Away\) "Robbie Hunter \(Home and
Away\)"), but he was turned down by the _Home and Away_ producers and the role
went to [Jason Smith](/wiki/Jason_Smith_\(actor\) "Jason Smith \(actor\)").[1]
Hemsworth was then asked to return and try out for the role of Kim Hyde.[1] He
won the role and had to relocate to Sydney to film his scenes.[2] Of joining
_Home and Away_ , Hemsworth said "The role in _Home and Away_ is consistent
work for me and is a great experience. It is so fast-paced and basically it
allows me to learn a lot about the industry."[2] Hemsworth appeared for three
and a half years on _Home and Away_ , before leaving in 2007 to focus on his
film career.[3][4] Hemsworth returned to the set of _Home and Away_ in
November 2014 to film a scene in the [Pier Diner](/wiki/Summer_Bay#Pier_Diner
"Summer Bay"), as an [extra](/wiki/Extra_\(acting\) "Extra \(acting\)") and
not as his character Kim Hyde, in which he was seen at a table in the
background, wearing a black baseball cap.[5][6] He appeared in the episode
broadcast on 19 May 2015.[6]

## Storylines[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Kim_Hyde&action=edit&section=2 "Edit
section: Storylines")]

Kim arrives in Summer Bay after his father, Barry ([Ivar
Kants](/wiki/Ivar_Kants "Ivar Kants")) is appointed principal of Summer Bay
High at the start of the school year. It is clear the two do not get along and
already had previous issues when Barry taught at Kim's previous school. He
quickly befriends Robbie and embarrasses him in front of his girlfriend Tasha
Andrews ([Isabel Lucas](/wiki/Isabel_Lucas "Isabel Lucas")) when he questions
Robbie's virginity. The moment is interrupted when the three witness [Noah
Lawson](/wiki/Noah_Lawson "Noah Lawson") ([Beau Brady](/wiki/Beau_Brady "Beau
Brady")) [wipe out](/wiki/Wipe_out_\(surfing\) "Wipe out \(surfing\)") while
surfing. Kim dives into the sea and saves Noah. Robbie and Tasha are impressed
with his heroics and suggest he join a swimming team, which Kim declines
having previously been on one. Kim and Barry's relationship becomes more and
more strained to the point where Kim moves in with Tasha and [Irene
Roberts](/wiki/Irene_Roberts "Irene Roberts"). His ex, Brooke McPherson
([Alyssa McClelland](/wiki/Alyssa_McClelland "Alyssa McClelland")) returns,
telling him he is the father of her son Charlie. Kim is furious when realises
Barry knew about the child but grows to love Charlie. The truth is revealed
that Charlie is not his son and Brooke leaves, with Kim and Barry's
relationship no better than before. He then drops out of school and begins
working at the gym after Tasha buys him a share much to his father's chagrin.
He re-enrolls after Noah's death and participates in a memorial concert.

[Matilda Hunter](/wiki/Matilda_Hunter "Matilda Hunter") ([Indiana
Evans](/wiki/Indiana_Evans "Indiana Evans")) takes an interest in Kim and
feigns drowning to get his attention only for it to backfire and end up
struggling for real. However, she is rescued. Matilda overhears Kim talking to
Robbie and saying he will ask out his sister. However, Kim means Robbie and
Matilda's older sister, [Kit](/wiki/Kit_Hunter "Kit Hunter") ([Amy
Mizzi](/wiki/Amy_Mizzi "Amy Mizzi")). Kim and Kit begin a relationship before
she heads to Paris. Kim gets his driver's license and takes a camping trip
with Robbie and Tasha. Robbie steps on a needle and fears he has contracted
HIV. Kim supports him, but their friendship becomes somewhat strained when
Robbie's behaviour becomes erratic. During this time, Kim becomes close to
Noah's widow, [Hayley](/wiki/Hayley_Smith_\(Home_and_Away\) "Hayley Smith
\(Home and Away\)") ([Bec Cartwright](/wiki/Bec_Cartwright "Bec Cartwright");
[Ella Scott Lynch](/wiki/Ella_Scott_Lynch "Ella Scott Lynch")) and they have a
brief fling which ends.

Kim dates [Eve Jacobsen](/wiki/Eve_Jacobsen "Eve Jacobsen") ([Emily
Perry](/wiki/Emily_Perry_\(Australian_actress\) "Emily Perry \(Australian
actress\)")), who is using the identity of [Zoe
McCallister](/wiki/Zoe_McCallister "Zoe McCallister"). When Kim returns from
the city after a break, he is alarmed to learn that Eve has apparently died
and was the Summer Bay Stalker. His next big shock is Hayley is pregnant and
he is possibly the father, [Scott Hunter](/wiki/Scott_Hunter_\(Home_and_Away\)
"Scott Hunter \(Home and Away\)") ([Kip Gamblin](/wiki/Kip_Gamblin "Kip
Gamblin")) who is dating Hayley is also a possibility. Scott and Hayley break
up, and Kim gets together with Hayley and he proposes, but some people suspect
Hayley is only with Kim because of the baby. On the day of the wedding, Hayley
discovers she still loves Scott and jilts Kim at the altar. Scott proposes to
Hayley and they plan to leave Summer Bay with baby [Noah](/wiki/Noah_Smith
"Noah Smith"), which infuriates Kim and he seeks legal advice. After a
meeting, Kim is run over by a car and it is revealed he does not share the
baby's blood type, meaning he is not the father despite paternity results
saying so (they were secretly swapped by Eve). Scott and Hayley leave for
Paris and Kim becomes depressed.

He then befriends [Kylie Kopperton](/wiki/Kylie_Kopperton "Kylie Kopperton")
(Leah Etkind) who introduces him to ecstasy. Kim overdoses one night and is
thrown out of a car outside the hospital during the storm. [Rachel
Armstrong](/wiki/Rachel_Armstrong "Rachel Armstrong") ([Amy
Mathews](/wiki/Amy_Mathews "Amy Mathews")) finds him and he is revived. She
becomes his counsellor in order to help him handle his recent grief. They
become closer and Kim steps up his quest to woo her and they become a couple.
[Brian Helpman](/wiki/Brian_Helpman "Brian Helpman") (John Noble), Rachel's
superior begins blackmailing her about the relationship and Rachel is forced
to come clean and is luckily able to continue as a doctor. Kim is shocked when
Barry is unmasked as the murderer of local mayor [Josh
West](/wiki/Josh_West_\(Home_and_Away\) "Josh West \(Home and Away\)")
([Daniel Collopy](/wiki/Daniel_Collopy "Daniel Collopy")) who blackmailed him
about the death of Kim's mother, Kerry and stands by his father. During this
time, [Charlie McKinnon](/wiki/Charlie_McKinnon "Charlie McKinnon") (Matt
Levett) befriends Kim and Rachel and becomes dangerously obsessed with Kim.
Charlie kidnaps Rachel but he is foiled and instituationalised. When Eve
reappears much to the shock of everyone at [Jack
Holden](/wiki/Jack_Holden_\(Home_and_Away\) "Jack Holden \(Home and Away\)")
([Paul O'Brien](/wiki/Paul_O%27Brien "Paul O'Brien")) and [Martha
MacKenzie](/wiki/Martha_MacKenzie "Martha MacKenzie")'s ([Jodi
Gordon](/wiki/Jodi_Gordon "Jodi Gordon")) wedding and causes an explosion
which kills her, [Tracey Thompson](/wiki/Tracey_Thompson "Tracey Thompson")
(Sarah Enright) and Rachel's mother, [Elaine](/wiki/Elaine_Armstrong "Elaine
Armstrong") (Julie Hudspeth), Kim is among the casualties. He, Robbie,
Matilda, Martha, Kit and [Belle Taylor](/wiki/Belle_Taylor "Belle Taylor")
([Jessica Tovey](/wiki/Jessica_Tovey "Jessica Tovey")) are airlifted to the
city but their helicopter crashes in the bush, leaving them stranded. While
the others go for help, Kim stays behind with Kit and fearing they will die,
the pair have sex. The party is found and Kim and Kit's liaison is revealed to
Rachel, who forgives Kim.

Following an unfounded accusation from [Tara O'Neill](/wiki/Tara_O%27Neill
"Tara O'Neill") (Cashelle Dunn) of sexual assault and his wedding to Rachel,
the drama in Kim's life escalates when Kit returns for the Christmas,
announcing she is pregnant with their child. Rachel has some difficulty
accepting after plans to adopt [Lee Morton](/wiki/Lee_Morton "Lee Morton")'s
([Natasha Lee](/w/index.php?title=Natasha_Lee&action=edit&redlink=1 "Natasha
Lee \(page does not exist\)")) newborn son
[Joe](/wiki/Joe_Morton_\(Home_and_Away\) "Joe Morton \(Home and Away\)"), fall
through. Kim and Kit grow closer together and Kim and Rachel's marriage begins
to feel strained. Kim and Kit share a kiss, and following the revelation that
Rachel slept with [Hugh Sullivan](/wiki/Hugh_Sullivan "Hugh Sullivan")
([Rodger Corser](/wiki/Rodger_Corser "Rodger Corser")), Kim decides to leave
her and be with Kit and baby Archie in the city.

## Reception[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Kim_Hyde&action=edit&section=3 "Edit
section: Reception")]

For his portrayal of Kim, Hemsworth won the Most Popular New Male Talent award
at the [2005 Logie Awards](/wiki/Logie_Awards_of_2005 "Logie Awards of 2005"),
he also received a nomination for [Most Popular
Actor](/wiki/Logie_Award_for_Most_Popular_Actor "Logie Award for Most Popular
Actor").[7][8] The following year, Hemsworth was again nominated for Most
Popular Actor.[9] At the first [Digital Spy Soap
Awards](/wiki/Digital_Spy_Soap_Awards "Digital Spy Soap Awards"), Hemsworth
earned a nomination for Best Exit.[10] Hannah Rand of _[The Daily
Telegraph](/wiki/The_Daily_Telegraph_\(Sydney\) "The Daily Telegraph
\(Sydney\)")_ said Hemsworth was "born to play hunky high school dropout" Kim,
due to his physique and pin-up looks.[1]
